item.title: Donkey Kong Bananza: Lagoon Layer SL101 Banandium Gem Locations
item.description:
Lagoon Layer SL101 contains fifteen Banandium Gems in Donkey Kong: Bananza , consisting of Gems 26-40 of the Lagoon Layer. Some of these are tremendously tricky to find, necessitating trips to the layer above or tunneling beneath sections of the stage to hunt them down. Since it's one of the game's earlier areas, it's also likely that you won't have upgraded Sonar yet, further complicating the hunt.

This guide will explain how to track down all fifteen Banandium Gems in Lagoon Layer SL101, in Donkey Kong Bananza . We'll provide map images and detailed explanations of how to reach some of the trickier and better-hidden ones, such as those found above the Orang-Hang Highway, or the one that requires a fair bit of exploring on SL100 before you can even reach it.

26 - Landed in Salvager's Landing

This one is a freebie, becoming available when you break the Void Stake that blocks the path down to SL101. You'll reach this one just by following the story and progressing through SL100. It's worth three Banandium Gems for unlocking skill points.

27 - Shifty Smash: A Wall Hanging in Air

This next one is right behind you when you enter, though it may be worth waiting until you've reflooded the area so you don't have to spend as long climbing back up if you mess up the jump. You'll need to grab some terrain and use it to perform a jump shot, allowing you to reach the spot shown on the map in image 1. From here, you can punch a switch to cause a concrete wall to appear and a timer to start counting down. Tear off some of the explosive material nearby and throw it at the wall, rinsing and repeating until the entire concrete wall has been destroyed. If the timer runs out, you'll have to start over, but the time limit is fairly generous. Once the wall is destroyed, the Banandium Gem will appear where the switch was.

28 - On the Ceiling of the Floor

This one is well-hidden but pretty easy to reach. You can find it underneath the area shown on the map above, but you'll need to reflood the map so you can swim underneath and reach it. You'll achieve this as you play through the level normally, so just remember to come back and take a little swim once the water level is high enough to get there.

29 - Over The Thorny Path

This Banandium Gem, along with the next two on this list, is found inside a special challenge called "Thorn-Choked Conveyor". You can find this challenge at the spot shown on the map above, and enter it by performing a Dive Punch. Once inside, the first Banandium Gem is straight ahead, blocked by some thorns. Rip a chunk of stone out of the ground and swing it at the thorns to clear yourself a path to the gem.

30 - Into the Thorny Nook

This next one can be found a little further along the path, after using chunks of the explosive floor to blow away a wall of thorns. After passing the wall, look for a smaller wall of thorns blocking off a side path, which you can blast open in the same way to reveal this Banandium Gem.

31 - Through the Thorny Walls

Returning to the main path after grabbing the last Banadium Gem, continue blasting your way through the thorn walls to reach the end of the challenge, where one final Banandium Gem awaits.

32 - The Salvager's Stash

This Banandium Gem is really easy to grab, since it's in an enclosed underground room beneath the Style Shop. You can't dig down into it, but if you head to the spot shown on the map above, you can find a path that leads right to it, underneath a house. There's a Salvager NPC elsewhere in the level who will mark the gem's location on your map if you talk to them, but this only shows the gem's location and doesn't help with finding the way down to it.

33 - Battle: Concrete-Wall Clash

To earn this Banandium Gem, you'll have to head for the location shown on the map above, where you'll find the entrance to a battle challenge. Your goal here is to take out two Crockoids within a very tight time limit, further complicated by the concrete walls separating sections of the area. You should grab some explosive terrain and hurl it at the first concrete wall to break it, then run through and grab another to throw at the first Crockoid. Once the Crockoid is just a golden skeleton, punch it to take it out. Throw explosive terrain to blast open the next wall, run through, and repeat the process on the second Crockoid to win. As long as you move fast, you can take this out really quickly.

If you have Kong Bananza unlocked, you could also use the empowered punches from that form to break the walls and crack the armor on the Crockoids, though it takes slightly longer than using the terrain if you haven't upgraded the punches for that form.

34 - Up, Over, and Across

You'll earn this one as you progress through the story for this area, when you set out to pull the second plug and continue reflooding the area. You'll have to use explosive terrain to break a blockage on a climbable wall, before heading up and across a mesh ceiling to reach the gem.

35 - Within the Fast-Growing Grass

To get this one, you'll need to finish reflooding the area, and then head to the spot shown on the map above. Swim under this island to find a mesh you can hang from. You'll need to move fast once you grab onto the mesh, as thorns will grow on it as you climb and knock you off if they reach you. Move forward until you reach the fork in the path, then wrap around to the right and make for the gem as fast as you can.

36 - Hangin' on Orangu-Hang Highway!

Another one you'll find just by following the story, you can track down this Banandium Gem after briefly returning to SL100 and diving back down a little further on. You'll arrive at the start of the Orangu-Hang Highway after dropping back down to SL100, with this Banandium Gem right ahead of you.

37 - Concrete Wall on the Moving Floor

To get this one, you'll first need to cross the Orangu-Hang Highway, after getting Banandium Gem 36. On the far side of it is a platform where an enemy that creates columns of explosive terrain can be found. You'll want to grab a chunk of explosive terrain and throw it at the concrete wall above the Orangu-Hang Highway (see images 1 and 2). After that, bait the enemy into creating a pillar near the opening you created, climb to the top of it, and grab some terrain to perform a double jump and get up above the Orangu-Hang Highway. From here, you just need to head for the section with a moving platform and ride it to the Banandium Gem.

38 - Outskirts of the Fishing Village

Easily the hardest Banandium Gem to find in all of SL101, you'll need to head up to SL100 to begin the search for this one. Teeleport to the fast-travel point shown in the first image, and make your way to the spot shown in the second image. By performing a Dive Punch to break through the ground here, you'll find a hidden Void Stake that, when destroyed, releases this Banandium Gem. It promptly falls down a hole leading back to SL101, so dive after it and snag three points of progress toward your next skill point.

39 - Crossed to the Kong Elder's Court!

Another one you'll find during the story, this Banandium Gem can be found near the Kong Elder, who can be reached once you've reflooded the area and thus raised the bridge leading to him.

40 - The Ship Stern's Snack

This final Banandium Gem is easy to reach once you've got access to the Kong Elder's Court. Just wrap around the huge mound of Shipping Containers behind the Kong Elder, and make your way to the spot shown on the map above to claim the final Banandium Gem for SL101. You'll have to do a little climbing, but it's easy to reach now that the area is flooded.

Donkey Kong Bananza
8.5 /10
Released
July 17, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

item.title: Grounded 2: Editions Explained
item.description:
It's almost time to get shrunk again with Grounded 2 's highly anticipated release just around the corner. Grounded 2 invites you to step back into the tiny shoes of its now older teen protagonists, Max, Willow, Hoops, and Pete, in the brand-new location of Brookhollow Park. Developer Obsidian Entertainment also recently announced two editions of Grounded 2 when the game launches in Game Preview for Xbox Series X/S, Xbox PC, and Xbox Cloud, alongside Steam Early Access, Game Pass Ultimate, and PC Game Pass - the Standard Edition and the majestically-titled Minotaurs, Myrmidons, and Mants: Oh My! Founder’s Edition.

If you can't wait to explore the world of Grounded 2 , you'll probably be eager to know what each edition provides and when you can get them, especially if you're eager to return to the size of an ant in style.

Grounded 2 Editions Explained

As recently announced via Xbox Wire, when the Game Preview/Early Access period begins on July 29, 2025, players can jump straight into the Standard Edition of Grounded 2 or play the game day one through Xbox Game Pass Ultimate and PC Game Pass . Alternatively, also from July 29, players can buy or upgrade to the Minotaurs, Myrmidons, and Mants: Oh My! Founder’s Edition/Founder's Edition Pack , which comes with some additional features, with both editions outlined below:

Standard Edition

The Standard Edition of Grounded 2 will be available for purchase for USD $29.99 during the Game Preview/Early Access period. Like the Founder's Edition, the Standard Edition comes with a copy of Grounded 2 in Game Preview. However, players who get the Standard Edition will also get The Tools of Yore decorative set , something that all players receive for free whichever edition of the game they choose as a thank-you from Obsidian Entertainment.

Minotaurs, Myrmidons, and Mants: Oh My! Founder’s Edition

In contrast, The Minotaurs, Myrmidons, and Mants: Oh My! Founder’s Edition of Grounded 2 will cost USD $39.99 or, alternatively, USD $10.00 for the Founder's Pack upgrade for those who might choose to purchase or have access to the Standard Edition. Therefore, if you plan on playing Grounded 2 on Xbox Game Pass Ultimate/PC Game Pass or, if you later change your mind after obtaining the Standard Edition, the Founder's Edition will also be available as the Founder's Pack upgrade , which costs USD $10.00 . The Founder's Edition/Founder's Pack upgrade includes the following:

  • Grounded 2 digital game download.
  • Four premium skins with their own custom emotes - the mighty Minotaur, the stoic Myrmidon, the elusive Rogue, and the fearsome Mant.
  • The “ONYX-PRO, Inside the Game” digital artbook and soundtrack , taking players behind-the-scenes into the game's development and to be updated throughout the game's Game Preview/Early Access period.
  • The Tools of Yore decorative set.
  • More items with secrets.

Obsidian has also confirmed that the cosmetic items in the Founder's Edition/Founder's Pack upgrade won't affect gameplay or progression. The main differences between the Standard Edition and Founder's Edition seem to be mainly cosmetic, plus behind-the-scenes digital art/soundtrack content. However, the addition of 'More items will be added with secrets' in the Founder's Edition suggests it could also contain even more features yet to be announced, though what these might be remains to be seen.

Grounded 2 is also launching into Game Preview and Early Access with various accessibility features, including Arachnophobia Safe Mode, colorblind mode, subtitle customization, and more. With Xbox Play Anywhere, you can also play Grounded 2 across Xbox consoles and Xbox PC with full cross-saves at no additional cost via a single purchase.

9 Images
9 Images
Grounded 2
Action
Adventure
RPG
Sandbox
Exploration
Systems
Released
2025-07

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Obsidian Entertainment
Publisher(s)
Xbox Game Studios
Platform(s)
Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC

item.title: Best Psychological Horror Games For Beginners
item.description:
Summary

  • Psychological horror games offer deeper scares through narrative and themes, not just jump scares.
  • Some games, like Doki Doki Literature Club, are free and serve as great entry points to the genre.
  • Games like Soma prioritize moral dilemmas over scares, making them a must-play for psychological horror fans.

Psychological horror is one of the bread-and-butter gaming subgenres, as these titles tend to stray away from typical jumpscare fests in favor of something more in-depth. These games often spin complicated narratives that gain more clarity as the game progresses, usually culminating in a twist ending that throws players off.

Sometimes they delve into rather serious and dark topics at the heart of the story, which might make these games rather daunting for those who are new to the genre. However, gamers need not fear. There are games out there that are ideal for those who have never experienced psychological horror before.

7 Doki Doki Literature Club

Psychological Horror For Free

3 Images
3 Images
Doki Doki Literature Club!
Visual Novel
Horror
Systems
Released
September 22, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Team Salvato
Platform(s)
PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

When venturing forth into a new interest, most will resign themselves to having to fork over some hard-earned cash to get started. But one of the benefits of gaming as a hobby is that, occasionally, players can snag a great bargain. This is the case for Doki Doki Literature Club , available for a grand total of $0. In this psychological horror dressed up as a dating sim, the player is an ordinary student who joins a literature club at his best friend's behest, growing closer to the other members and writing poetry to share with them.

Even with the warning given ahead of time, very little can prepare the players for the horrors that lie ahead, which arrive as a shock for even the hardiest of horror aficionados. Delving deep into psychological horror littered with disturbing imagery, this game is not for the faint of heart. The cute graphics and wholesome first hour of playtime hide many dark secrets.

6 Layers of Fear

The Absence of Combat Removes Any Overwhelming Challenges

Layers of Fear
Horror
Systems
Released
February 16, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
7 /10

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Bloober Team
Platform(s)
Switch, PlayStation (Original), Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

Most gamers have heard the term "walking simulator," which describes a game where the only real mechanic is simply moving forward. While Layers of Fear was not the pioneer of this genre, it is a famous example , especially within the community of horror games. As a nameless painter who is desperate to finish working on what he thinks will be his crowning achievement, the player will guide him through a labyrinthian mansion as more about his buried past is unveiled.

The player's actions have an impact on what ending they will achieve, but either way, the truth is revealed about the tragic direction his life turned, and explains the break in his psyche that he is struggling with now. This shocking twist makes the psychological horror aspect of this game hit even harder.

5 The Dark Pictures: Little Hope

The Game Doesn't Wear Out Its Welcome

The Dark Pictures Anthology: Little Hope
7.6 /10
Released
October 30, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Supermassive Games
Platform(s)
Xbox One, PC, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

The second installment in the Dark Pictures Anthology was Little Hope , completely separate from the first game in the series. This standalone game introduces a new cast of characters who are on a writers' retreat with their college professor, John, when the bus crashes, leaving them stranded in the eponymous town. Any efforts to leave the town's boundaries deposit them back inside, so with no other options available, they walk further inside to look for help.

There is about as much help to find in this town as there is hope, as the characters find themselves seeing visions of the past and terrifying ghosts. These ghosts hunt them through the entire game right to the bitter ending, which reveals there is more afoot here. The Dark Pictures always has a twist up its sleeve, but Little Hope's firmly lands it in the realm of psychological horror. Luckily for players short on time, the game reaches this conclusion in about 5 hours, so players who don't want to be bogged down by a lengthy game will find this one the perfect fit.

4 Detention

Simple Mechanics, But Plenty of Scares

Detention
8.0 /10
Released
January 12, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
RedCandleGames
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Switch
Powered by

RedCandle have already made forays into the psychological horror genre, with one of their most successful outings being Detention . Set during the White Terror period in Taiwan, students Wei and Ray find themselves trapped in their school after a storm cuts off their escape. Players take on the role of Ray, as she explores the school during their imprisonment there. She sees terrifying visions sometimes, with one involving seeing Wei's corpse strung up in the Auditorium.

From then on, Ray must carefully explore the school. Players must complete puzzles to progress while taking care to avoid the terrifying ghosts that now haunt the school, which Ray can avoid by holding her breath as she passes by. Despite the rather simple style of the game, it packs more of a punch than expected with the psychological scares. Still, newcomers shouldn't fear too much, as they won't be completely overwhelmed.

3 Alan Wake

Heavy on the Narrative for Those Who Enjoy Stories

Alan Wake
9 /10
7.3 /10
Released
February 16, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Language, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Developer(s)
Remedy Entertainment
Platform(s)
Xbox 360, PS4, PS5, PC, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

While Alan Wake 2 has eclipsed the success of its predecessor, Alan Wake is the game to start with for newcomers, as the second game does rely on the player having some knowledge of prior events. Playing as the titular writer who found fame with popular crime novels, Alan hits a slump in his writing. His wife Alice takes him on a vacation to the scenic Bright Falls in hopes to get the creative juices flowing, but they get more than they bargained for when the horror begins.

From there on, the game devolves into a nightmare. Alan must find a way to save Alice while fending off shadowy creatures with the use of light, as that is the one force they are vulnerable to. While it may not sound like a psychological horror to begin with, the story develops as the game progresses, which is certain to put players' mental fortitude to the test.

2 Soma

Prioritizes Difficult Questions and Moral Dilemmas Over Scares

SOMA
8 /10
9.8 /10
Released
September 15, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Frictional Games
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Frictional Games have been scaring players for years now, kicking off their horror career with Penumbra and Amnesia before releasing Soma in 2015, which may be their greatest game so far. Gamers play as Simon Jarrett, a man who recently suffered a brain injury in an accident. He agrees to partake in an experimental brain scan, which does more than just take a peek at his brain. It uploads his entire consciousness into a robot body stuck in a research facility known as Pathos-II, which has fallen to wreck and ruin. Other survivors are pumped with a facsimile of life from machines, and are more surviving than really living.

Guided by the voice of the scientist Catherine, Simon sets out to launch Ark, which is said to be the ticket out of here. However, the ending is something no one could have predicted, resulting in one of the bleakest conclusions in gaming history. This ending, and indeed some of the decisions and scenes throughout the game, raise some fascinating questions about what it means to be human, and if machines are living beings. These questions and moral dilemmas are at the forefront of the game much more than monsters, which players can even make harmless by playing in safe mode. For those looking to delve into the psychological aspect of psychological horror, Soma cannot be recommended enough.

1 Silent Hill 2

A Shining Example of the Genre

10 Images
10 Images
Silent Hill 2
9.0 /10
Released
September 25, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Violence
Developer(s)
Team Silent
Platform(s)
PlayStation 2, Xbox (Original), PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

For a person to think that their late wife penned and sent a letter three years after her death seems like utter madness, or at the very least a strong sense of denial and wishful thinking. But this is the item in James's hand at the start of Silent Hill 2 , which he claims was sent to him even though she has long since been dead. This letter is what brought him back to their 'special place,' the scenic vacationing spot known as Silent Hill. But it is neither scenic, nor somewhere that anyone would ever want to spend their well-earned vacationing time, as this place is filled with nothing but monsters.

The player travels to various locations in the town, and meets others such as Laure, Eddie, Angela, and Maria, the latter of whom bears an uncanny resemblance to James's wife Mary. Players are often left wondering if these people are even real as they explore the town, kill a few monsters, and flee in terror from Pyramid Head up until the game's bitter conclusion. This shocking ending was just the cherry on top of this masterpiece of a game, as it truly is one of the best examples of psychological horror. Players don't need to have played the first to delve in. The remake has made Silent Hill highly accessible now, meaning there is no excuse not to play it.

item.title: 8 Best Character Designs in Final Fantasy, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Lightning from Final Fantasy 13 is iconic due to her character design standing out in an otherwise divisive game.
  • Kefka Palazzo from Final Fantasy 6 looks the part of a mad jester with an intimidating presence in his chaotic evil design.
  • Cloud Strife from Final Fantasy 7 is iconic mainly for his spiky blonde hair and backstory, emphasizing his character design.

Final Fantasy is a series known for its amazing character designs that fans love. No matter how the franchise's quality has dipped or swerved during its run, one thing that fans can unanimously agree on is that the art design has always been top-notch.

This makes some of the most notable heroes and villains in Final Fantasy all the more iconic. Their silhouette and garb are more than enough for players to identify these characters, showing the impact they've had on the gaming community.

Spoiler Warning: Some character and plot details are touched upon in several entries on the list.

8 Lightning (Final Fantasy 13)

Her Character Design Stands Out in a Divisive Game

Final Fantasy 13
6 /10
7.7 /10
Released
March 9, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Square Enix
Publisher(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PS3, Xbox 360, PC
Powered by
  • Appears in: Final Fantasy 13 , Final Fantasy 13: Lightning Returns

The Final Fantasy 13 trilogy has its detractors, but fans can't help but agree that the protagonist from two of the three games is as iconic as they come. Despite the unfair comparisons to Cloud, Lightning's brooding personality and strong will turned her into an easy protagonist for players to like, after a point.

Her original look is great, although players love the variety of outfits she can wear in Lightning Returns . She is a strong and powerful female character in gaming, something that Final Fantasy was in dire need of after conforming to gender roles for the majority of its run.

7 Kefka Palazzo (Final Fantasy 6)

The Mad Jester Certainly Looks the Part

Final Fantasy 6
13
9.1 /10
Released
October 11, 1994

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Square Enix, Square
Publisher(s)
Square Enix, Square
Platform(s)
SNES, Android, iOS, Nintendo Game Boy Advance, PC, PS1, PS4, Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by
  • Appears in: Final Fantasy 6

Kefka could've looked completely ridiculous, but Yoshitaka Amano ensured that this mad clown would look the part without losing his intimidating presence. From the very start of the game, it's clear that this wild and unhinged character would serve as a major thorn in players' sides.

He is the very definition of chaotic evil, something that is embodied in his character design. He betrays everyone standing in the way of him acquiring power, going so far as to become a pseudo-god who must be pulled down a peg after the heroes reunite in the World of Ruin.

6 Cloud Strife (Final Fantasy 7)

His Spiky Blonde Hair is Iconic

Final Fantasy 7
21
8.8 /10
Released
January 31, 1997

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Square Enix
Publisher(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PlayStation (Original), PC, iOS, Android, Nintendo Switch, Xbox One, PS4
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by
  • Appears in: Final Fantasy 7 , Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7 , Final Fantasy 7 Remake , Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth

Cloud Strife is one of the most iconic characters in video games, mostly due to his role as the protagonist of Final Fantasy 7 . His hairstyle is iconic, although the traditional Soldier garb he wears may not be as eye-catching as some other outfits that characters in this series wear.

Thankfully, the remakes do a great job of giving his outfit some identity, while Advent Children boasts the best Cloud look by far. However, in terms of the base game's character design, Cloud is more iconic for his hair and his backstory than the rest of his character design, which is not a bad thing in the slightest.

5 Yuna (Final Fantasy 10)

Her Heterochromia and Mystical Outfit Highlight Her Role as a Sacrificial Summoner

5 Images
5 Images
Final Fantasy 10
25
9.7 /10
Released
December 17, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Square Enix
Publisher(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PS2
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by
  • Appears in: Final Fantasy 10 , Final Fantasy 10-2

Meant to embody the look and innocence of a shrine maiden, Yuna is one of the most beloved Final Fantasy characters whose personality can be discerned from a single look at her character design.

She is as noble and duty-bound as they come, which is why it was important for Tidus to be a part of her journey so that she could amass the strength to fight against fate. Her heterochromia makes for a nice detail to set her apart, and the peppy take on her default outfit in Final Fantasy 10-2 conveys a light-hearted side of her personality that was bound to develop in a world that isn't facing a tragedy anymore.

4 Tifa Lockhart (Final Fantasy 7 Remake)

Boasts an Iconic Look That Turned Her into One of the Franchise's Most Iconic Characters

Final Fantasy 7 Remake
11
8.4 /10
Released
April 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Square Enix Business Division 1
Publisher(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by
  • Appears in: Final Fantasy 7 , Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7 , Final Fantasy 7 Remake , Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth

While the accusations of her design being structured for male audiences are definitely true, there's no denying that Tifa is one of the most iconic video game characters of all time, mainly because of her character design.

It conveys a sense of power and beauty that makes her one of the most exotic party members in the series. Her outfit is perfect for hand-to-hand combat, turning her into a blur of fists as she shines on the battlefield.

3 Vivi Ornitier (Final Fantasy 9)

The Quintessential Black Mage with Classic Character Design and a Tragic Story

Final Fantasy 9
26
9.3 /10
Released
July 7, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Square Enix
Publisher(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, Switch, PS1, Android, iOS, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by
  • Appears in: Final Fantasy 9

What could've seemed like lazy character design turned into one of the best visual storytelling devices in the series. In a world where Black Mages are artificial creations, a sentient Vivi decides to seek answers about his origins and receives some tragic answers for all his troubles.

He meets more Black Mages who look like him, eventually happening upon a village that informs him of his cruelly short lifespan. Despite lacking any facial features, Vivi's sadness and resilience can be felt in this moment as he refuses to let this stop him from saving the world, even if his days were numbered.

2 Squall Leonhart (Final Fantasy 8)

A Badass Jacket and a Ton of Belts Help This Character Stand Out as a Notable Protagonist

Final Fantasy 8
14
9.6 /10
Released
February 11, 1999

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Square Enix
Publisher(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PlayStation (Original), PC, Switch, PS4, Xbox One, iOS, Android
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by
  • Appears in: Final Fantasy 8

As much as fans may be split down the middle when it comes to Squall, fans can't deny that his character design is over-the-top in the best way possible. Players familiar with Tetsuya Nomura's character design know that he loves lathering his characters in belts and chains, and Squall is one of the most prominent examples of this.

Players may have their opinions, but Squall is a living personification of Nomura's character design. Given Nomura's legendary presence in the video game industry, it's easy to see why this statement goes a long way in elevating Squall's iconic design.

1 Sephiroth (Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth)

His Silver Hair and Massive Sword Make Him the Most Iconic Villain in the Series by a Country Mile

7 Images
7 Images
Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth
9 /10
45
9.2 /10
Released
February 29, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Square Enix
Publisher(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by
  • Appears in: Final Fantasy 7 , Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7 , Final Fantasy 7 Remake , Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth

To this day, Sephiroth's flowing silver locks and stupidly long sword will instill a sense of terror and awe in players. His look alone, coupled with his sinister gaze, helped Sephiroth become one of the most iconic video game villains of all time.

Later iterations of this character gave him a wing in his powered-up state, personifying his One-Winged Angel theme. It's easy to see why Sephiroth has such an immense screen presence based on his character design alone, and fans were rightfully frustrated to see his appearances used so liberally in the remakes that he loses his mystique from the original game.

item.title: All Free Fortnite Skins in July 2025
item.description:
There are more than 2,000 skins in Fortnite . Some are based on fan-favorite fictional characters like Spider-Man, Lara Croft, and Goku, while others allow players to take on the appearance of real-world icons and celebrities. Unfortunately, most of the game's skins will need to be purchased using V-Bucks, although there are opportunities to get free Fortnite skins from time to time.

The following guide contains a list of all of the free Fortnite skins that are currently available, as well as information on how players can unlock them and the deadlines for doing so. We'll update it whenever more free skins become available, so it's a good idea to check back here every once in a while to avoid missing out on future freebies.

Updated July 22, 2025, by Tom Bowen: Two new free Fortnite skins were recently added to the game. PS Plus subscribers can claim the Emerald Gamer pack from the PlayStation store to get their hands on a free Sage skin, while playing an online match with custom mutators and then getting 15 saves or epic saves in online Rocket League matches during the Summer Road Trip event will reward players with the Hairpin skin. Be sure to check back here soon for more free Fortnite skins, as we'll update this guide whenever new ones become available.

How to Unlock More Free Fortnite Skins

Free Fortnite skins are added to the game on a fairly regular basis, although the unlock method tends to vary from skin to skin. Many just require players to link their Epic accounts with third-party services, while others have their own specific quests. Ultimately, though, the best way to get free skins in Fortnite is to play the game regularly and keep up to date with all of the latest news. For those who only play periodically, it may be a good idea to bookmark this page and check back here regularly, as we'll update the table above whenever more free Fortnite skins become available.
